result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah J. Fischer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

Defendant Jeremiah J. Fischer in court with attorney Paul Harris Pignet.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire filed w/NC plea.  Court reviews rights, charges & penalties w/DE.  DE pleads NC.  Court accepts waiver, plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty.  Sentencing arguments.  Court orders fine/costs.  Appeal rights given the DE.
Status conference on December 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jeremiah J. Fischer in court with attorney Paul Harris Pignet.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives the preliminary hearing.  Court advises party of their right to a preliminary hearing, accepts waiver and binds over for Arraignment.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty.  Information to mirror complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 11:00 am.
